title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For any indication that both an electric and a magnetic force are exerted on the particle

1 point is earned: For any indication that these forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction

For example: The plates create a vertical electric field that exerts a vertical force on the particle. The cross-product of the velocity and the magnetic field also results in a vertical force. No matter what the charge of the particle, these forces are in opposite directions. Since the charge moves in a straight line they must be equal in magnitude.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned: For any indication that these forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction

No matter what the charge of the particle, these forces are in opposite directions. Since the charge moves in a straight line they must be equal in magnitude.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned: For any indication that both an electric and a magnetic force are exerted on the particle

1 point is earned: For any indication that these forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction

For example: The plates create a vertical electric field that exerts a vertical force on the particle. The cross-product of the velocity and the magnetic field also results in a vertical force. No matter what the charge of the particle, these forces are in opposite directions. Since the charge moves in a straight line they must be equal in magnitude.

The student response earns two of the following points:

1 point is earned: For any indication that both an electric and a magnetic force are exerted on the particle

1 point is earned: For any indication that these forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction

For example: The plates create a vertical electric field that exerts a vertical force on the particle. The cross-product of the velocity and the magnetic field also results in a vertical force. No matter what the charge of the particle, these forces are in opposite directions. Since the charge moves in a straight line they must be equal in magnitude.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For indicating that the charge is negative and a correct justification

Examples: The cross-product of the velocity and the magnetic field is directed upward. The particle curves downward as it leaves the plates, so it must be negative.

With the battery connection shown, the top plate is positive and the bottom one is negative. So the electric field is down. The particle would move down without the electric field, as it initially does when it leaves the plates, so the force from the field must be upward. That means the particle is negative.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
FB = qvB

1 point is earned: For equating the magnitudes of the electric and magnetic forces

qE = qvB so E = vB

1 point is earned: For using the relationship between the field and potential for parallel plates, E = V/d

V/d = vB

V = vBd

1 point is earned: For correct substitutions

V = (2.0 x 106 m/s)(0.30 T)(5.0 x 10-3 m)

V = 3000 V

V = vBd

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For equating the magnitudes of the centripetal and magnetic forces

mv2/r = qvB

m = qBr / v

1 point is earned: For realizing that the given distance to the collector plate is the diameter and using r = 2D

1 point is earned: For correct substitutions

m = (1.6 x 10-19 C)(0.30 T)(0.21 m) / (2.0 x 106 m/s)

m = (5.04 x 10-27 kg)

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For any indication that the straight-line motion means that all the particles leaving the plates have the same speed regardless of charge and mass, referencing part (c)

1 point is earned: For any indication that the radius of the circular motion depends on the charge and mass, as indicated by the equation m q = Br v from part (d)

1 point is earned: For any indication that radius depends only on the mass

1 point is earned: For any indication that radius depends only on the mass
